item.title: 'If I give you 90 hrs, are you giving me 90-hr pay?': INSEAD graduate's 5 questions amid L&T workweek row - Business Today
item.description:
‘If I give you 90 hrs, are you giving me 90-hr pay?’: INSEAD Graduate's 5 Questions Amid L&T Workweek Row

Publication Date: 2025-01-14 Source: Business Today

An INSEAD graduate raised critical questions concerning L&T's 90-hour workweek expectation, highlighting issues of pay, promotions, and the value of work-life balance.

  • Akshat Kharbanda challenges corporate India's narrative on work hours.
  • He questions if working 90 hours will be compensated fairly.
  • Kharbanda suggests results should matter more than hours worked.
  • The controversy includes comments from L&T's chairman defending long hours.
  • Experts note the need for enforcing overtime laws in India.
“Hard work matters when it’s for your growth, your goals, and meaningful outcomes. But working just to meet irrational expectations? Neither efficient nor sustainable.” - Akshat Kharbanda

This debate underscores the broader discussion on workplace expectations and the importance of valuing employees’ time and output.

item.title: Meta to lay off 3,600 employees; have decided to raise the bar, says Mark Zuckerberg - The Times of India
item.description:
Meta to Lay Off 3,600 Employees; Have Decided to Raise the Bar, Says Mark Zuckerberg

Publication Date: [Insert date here] Source: [Insert source here]

Meta has announced plans to lay off 3,600 employees, as CEO Mark Zuckerberg stated that the company has decided to raise the bar in terms of performance and standards.

  • Meta's layoff of 3,600 employees highlights ongoing challenges in the tech industry.
  • The decision comes amidst a push for increased performance metrics within the company.
  • Mark Zuckerberg's statement reflects a broader strategy to improve operational efficiency.
“We need to raise the bar and ensure we're working with the right team,” said Mark Zuckerberg.

This move is part of a larger trend in the tech industry where many companies are reevaluating their workforce and prioritizing performance and efficiency.

item.title: 'Complying with investigators to avoid bloodshed': Impeached South Korean President Yoon arrested - The Times of India
item.description:
Impeached South Korean President Yoon Arrested

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: [Source Name]

An overview of the arrest of South Korean President Yoon, who was impeached following allegations of misconduct. The situation unfolds amidst concerns over potential violence and the political implications.

  • Former President Yoon has been arrested as part of an investigation into corruption.
  • The arrest follows a political crisis that led to his impeachment.
  • Authorities are aiming to manage the situation to avoid unrest.
  • Concerns around the impact of this event on South Korea's political landscape persist.
“We are complying with investigators to ensure peace.”

The arrest of Yoon highlights the ongoing political strife in South Korea and raises questions about future governance.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Likened To Greg Chappell, 'Irritated' BCCI Official Slams Coach's Personal Aide - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Likened To Greg Chappell, 'Irritated' BCCI Official Slams Coach's Personal Aide

Publication Date: January 14, 2025

Source: NDTV

Amid a review of the Indian cricket team's performance in Australia, tensions arise between coach Gautam Gambhir and senior players regarding team culture and communication issues.

  • The BCCI has reviewed the Indian cricket team's performance in Australia.
  • Gambhir's relationship with senior players is reportedly strained due to differing views on team culture.
  • There are concerns regarding Gambhir's coaching style, drawing comparisons to former coach Greg Chappell.
  • BCCI officials express irritation over Gambhir's personal assistant’s involvement with the team.
  • The Indian dressing room appears uneasy ahead of the Champions Trophy from February 19 to March 9.
“The 'Chappell Way' doesn't work in India...players will stay, Gambhir will go.”

As the team prepares for the Champions Trophy, internal dynamics suggest challenges that may affect performance.

Grab these deals as inventory and prices may fluctuate quickly during the sale.

item.title: 'Imagine, I am only in the team because it is my farewell Test': Ravichandran Ashwin opens up on retireme - The Times of India
item.description:
Imagine, I am only in the team because it is my farewell Test: Ravichandran Ashwin opens up on retirement decision

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In an emotional disclosure, Ravichandran Ashwin reveals that his inclusion in the team is primarily due to his farewell Test, signaling his impending retirement from the sport.

  • Ashwin shares insights about his career and the decision-making process regarding retirement.
  • He reflects on the influence and support of his teammates and fans throughout his journey.
  • The impact of Ashwin's retirement on the team dynamics and future selections is discussed.
“It is bittersweet to think this is my farewell Test. I have loved every moment on the field.”

As Ashwin prepares to say goodbye to his playing days, he expresses gratitude for the opportunities and memories created in his cricketing career.

item.title: ‘Game Changer’ box office collection Day 5: Ram Charan starrer crosses Rs 100 crore mark, earns more than - TOI Etimes
item.description:
‘Game Changer’ Box Office Collection Day 5

Publication Date: Latest Update | Source: Times of India

Ram Charan's latest film, 'Game Changer', has achieved significant success at the box office. It crossed the Rs 100 crore mark and has earned over Rs 10 crore on its first Tuesday.

  • The film's total collection has exceeded Rs 100 crore.
  • On its first Tuesday, it collected more than Rs 10 crore.
  • Strong audience response and positive reviews contribute to its box office performance.
“This film is a game changer in the industry,” said a leading film critic.

The success of 'Game Changer' highlights the film's potential to remain a strong contender at the box office over the coming weeks.

item.title: Dense fog in Delhi, zero visibility in Noida amid cold wave; IMD predicts rain for today | Weather updates - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Dense Fog in Delhi Causes Zero Visibility in Noida Amid Cold Wave

Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Dense fog engulfed Delhi and Noida early Wednesday, leading to significantly reduced visibility and potential disruptions to flights and trains amid an ongoing cold wave.

  • Visibility issues persisted across the national capital region due to dense fog.
  • Delhi's temperature was recorded at 10°C around 5:30 AM, with a forecasted minimum of 9°C and a maximum of 19°C.
  • The India Meteorological Department (IMD) warned of ongoing cold conditions and potential rain.
  • Passengers faced disruptions at the Delhi airport, particularly for non-CAT III compliant flights.
  • Homeless individuals sought refuge in night shelters amid the cold temperatures.
“Zero visibility has prevailed over Palam since 4:30 IST, with southeasterly winds blowing at 6-8 kmph,” according to IMD.

The ongoing dense fog has not only impacted transportation but also highlighted the need for vigilance among commuters during this adverse weather condition.

item.title: OpenAI rolls out assistant-like feature 'Tasks' to take on Alexa, Siri - Deccan Herald
item.description:
OpenAI Introduces 'Tasks' Feature in ChatGPT to Compete with Alexa and Siri

Published: 15 January 2025, Source: Unknown

OpenAI has launched a beta feature called 'Tasks' for ChatGPT, aiming to enter the virtual assistant market and compete with established players like Siri and Alexa.

  • 'Tasks' allows users to set future reminders and daily updates.
  • ChatGPT will suggest tasks based on user interactions, which can be accepted or declined.
  • The introduction comes amidst increased competition in the AI assistant space, with Amazon and Apple updating their services.
  • The rollout will begin with Plus, Team, and Pro users on the web platform.

“OpenAI said that it will start rolling out the beta to Plus, Team, and Pro users globally over the next few days.”

The introduction of the 'Tasks' feature highlights OpenAI's commitment to expanding its capabilities and competing in the evolving landscape of AI-driven virtual assistants.

item.title: MGNREGS allocations could be increased for FY26 - Mint
item.description:
Potential Increase in MGNREGS Allocations for FY26

Publication Date: New Delhi | Source: Mint

The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) may see a higher budget allocation in FY26, following a year of improved rural economic conditions despite no hikes in FY25.

  • MGNREGS is crucial for providing employment to the rural poor in India.
  • Allocations for FY25 are expected to remain unchanged due to recent improvements in the rural economy.
  • FY26 may witness a slight increase in budget allocation compared to FY25.

item.title: This is a once-in-a-lifetime event you don't want to miss! - 91.1 Hot FM
item.description:
This is a once-in-a-lifetime event you don't want to miss!

Publication Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Latest in Space

Discovered in April of 2024, Comet C/2024 G3 (ATLAS) presents a rare viewing opportunity for skywatchers as it travels through Sagittarius, approaching its closest point to the sun on January 13, 2025.

  • The comet can be seen with the naked eye from the Southern Hemisphere around January 16 or 17, 2025.
  • This will be the first time in 160,000 years that the comet has been visible.
  • For best visibility, look towards the western horizon at twilight.
  • Binoculars will enhance the viewing experience.
  • Astronomers predict the comet will grow brighter as it nears the sun.
“Once in a 160,000 year comet seen from the International Space Station 😳 G3 Atlas won’t pass by Earth again until year 162025” — Latest in Space, January 12, 2025

Don't miss this breathtaking sight! Seek out a location with minimal light pollution for the best experience.

item.title: "Virat Kohli will not play even one Ranji Trophy match": Delhi official exposes star cricketer - Crictoday
item.description:
Virat Kohli Will Not Play Even One Ranji Trophy Match, Says Delhi Official

Publication Date: [Date of Publication] Source: The Indian Express

Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) secretary Ashok Sharma has expressed disappointment that star cricketer Virat Kohli will not participate in the Ranji Trophy, urging him to draw inspiration from players who prioritize domestic cricket.

  • Ashok Sharma's call for Virat Kohli to play in the Ranji Trophy.
  • Kohli last played for Delhi in 2012; faces criticism for not participating in domestic games.
  • Comparison with Mumbai players who compete in domestic cricket despite being contracted with the Indian team.
  • BCCI's direction emphasizes the importance of participating in the Ranji Trophy.
  • Ashok Sharma believes Kohli will not play even a single match for Delhi.
“The BCCI has issued directives in this regard but I don’t think Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant are going to represent Delhi even in one match.” - Ashok Sharma

This issue underscores a growing concern regarding the commitment of top players to domestic cricket, an area that seems to be lacking emphasis in Northern India.

item.title: Aquarius Daily Horoscope Today, January 15, 2025 advices trusting your instincts - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Aquarius Daily Horoscope Today, January 15, 2025 advises trusting your instincts

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Today, Aquarius, open-mindedness will help you make the most of personal and professional growth opportunities. Stay grounded and trust your instincts.

  • Personal and professional growth is within reach with clarity and instinct.
  • Love life benefits from curiosity and understanding; active listening strengthens connections.
  • Professional focus on flexibility and innovation; unexpected changes may lead to growth opportunities.
  • Financially, cautious optimism is advised; careful evaluation of opportunities is necessary.
  • A balanced approach to health involving physical activity and mindful eating is recommended.
"Your ability to remain adaptable will lead to rewarding outcomes."

In summary, today encourages Aquarians to navigate through challenges and opportunities with a positive outlook and trust in their instincts.

item.title: Tim Kaine grills Pete Hegseth over 'cheating' on wife, social media users ask what about Doug Emhoff - The Times of India
item.description:
Tim Kaine grills Pete Hegseth over 'cheating' on wife, social media users ask what about Doug Emhoff

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Not specified

This article discusses the exchange between Senator Tim Kaine and Fox News contributor Pete Hegseth regarding personal allegations stemming from social media, with public scrutiny also turned towards Doug Emhoff.

  • Senator Tim Kaine challenged Pete Hegseth about claims of infidelity.
  • Social media users highlighted similarities with accusations against Doug Emhoff, husband of Vice President Kamala Harris.
  • The discussion sparked widespread reactions online, questioning accountability and public figures’ conduct.
“Why is the focus only on Hegseth when similar issues surround others?” – a user's comment on Twitter.

This incident underscores the increasing interconnection between personal lives of public figures and public scrutiny through social media.

item.title: FIR against AAP over social media posts using images of PM Modi, Amit Shah - The Indian Express
item.description:
5 FIRs lodged against AAP on complaints of BJP members for posts on PM, Shah

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The Delhi Police have filed five FIRs against the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) following complaints from BJP members regarding objectionable posts aimed at PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah, alleging efforts to incite communal unrest.

  • The FIRs were filed at the North Avenue police station.
  • BJP members accuse AAP of using its official handles on X to post defamatory content.
  • AAP has responded by asserting that these actions reveal BJP's fear of their popularity.
  • Brijesh Rai from Delhi BJP filed four complaints related to specific posts, claiming they mislead the public.
  • The police are currently investigating the complaints made against AAP.
“False cases are being registered to divert attention from real issues concerning the people.” - AAP spokesperson

The complaints suggest a rising tension between the AAP and BJP, affecting the current political landscape in Delhi.

item.title: DJI Flip is a $439, fully foldable camera drone - TechCrunch
item.description:
DJI Flip is a $439, fully foldable camera drone

Publication Date: Just announced
Source: TechCrunch

DJI introduces the Flip, a foldable camera drone designed for photographers and videographers, priced at $439.

  • The Flip features 4K video recording at 60 frames per second and 100fps slow motion capability.
  • It boasts a 48-megapixel camera with up to 4x zoom.
  • Weighing 249 grams, it offers improved battery life with up to 31 minutes of flight time.
  • The drone includes automatic braking to prevent high altitude collisions.
  • The Flip is set to start shipping in the U.S. on Tuesday.
“The Flip continues to blur the lines in DJI’s existing consumer portfolio, combining the simplicity of the DJI Neo with the stunning photo capabilities of the DJI Mini.”

The DJI Flip stands out in the consumer drone market with its unique features and capabilities aimed at enhancing outdoor photography.

item.title: Wholesale Price Inflation Rises To 2.37% In December - News18
item.description:
Wholesale Price Inflation Rises To 2.37% In December

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: News18

Wholesale price inflation rose to 2.37 per cent in December 2024, primarily due to increases in manufactured products, despite a decline in food prices.

  • The Wholesale Price Index (WPI) based inflation was 1.89% in November 2024.
  • It was 0.86% in December 2023.
  • Inflation in food items eased to 8.47% in December from 8.63% in November.
  • Inflation in vegetables was 28.65% in December.
  • Potato inflation remained high at 93.20%.
  • The fuel and power category saw a deflation of 3.79% in December.
  • Manufactured items inflation rose to 2.14% in December.
Retail inflation eased to a 4-month low of 5.22% in December due to falling food prices.

This rise in wholesale price inflation indicates changes in the market dynamics and could influence policy decisions moving forward.

item.title: Why the race to the Moon will heat up in 2025: 'Good time for lunar economy' - India Today
item.description:
Why the race to the Moon will heat up in 2025: 'Good time for lunar economy'

Published On: Jan 15, 2025

Source: indiatodayglobal

2025 marks a thrilling chapter in lunar exploration as multiple companies embark on missions to uncover lunar secrets and expand the lunar economy following years of development.

  • Firefly, Ispace, and Intuitive Machines are set to launch major missions to the Moon.
  • Firefly's Blue Ghost aims to land near Mons Latreille in Mare Crisium, carrying geological experiments.
  • Ispace's Resilience will explore Mare Frigoris and test algae-based food production.
  • Intuitive Machines will launch the Athena lander targeting the Moon's south pole with ice-mining experiments.
  • NASA is actively involved, pushing towards a sustainable human presence on the Moon.
“This is a good time for the lunar economy.” - Jason Kim, CEO of Firefly

The race for lunar exploration is set to escalate, promising advancements in science and competition among nations.

item.title: Donald Trump to create new department to collect revenue from foreign sources on inauguration day - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Trump to Establish New Revenue Collection Agency on Inauguration Day

Date: Jan 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

US President-elect Donald Trump announced plans to create a new government agency called the External Revenue Service on January 20, coinciding with his second inauguration. This agency will focus on collecting tariffs and duties from foreign sources as part of a broader strategy to implement new import tariffs.

  • Trump aims to shift revenue collection from the IRS to the new department.
  • He criticized existing trade agreements for burdening American taxpayers.
  • The proposal includes tariffs of 10% on global imports and higher tariffs on goods from Canada, Mexico, and China.
  • Economic forecasts predict significant revenue generation from the proposed tariffs, but potential adverse effects on the economy.
  • Senator Ron Wyden condemned Trump's plan as a tax increase on families and small businesses.
"We will begin charging those that make money off of us with Trade, and they will start paying, FINALLY, their fair share." - Donald Trump

This initiative reflects Trump's ongoing commitment to reshape U.S. trade policy and revenue structure as he resumes presidential duties.
